definitions: material that resists electrical current flow and prevents electrical leakage
substance that prevents heat transfer between objects or environments
material that blocks or reduces the transmission of sound waves
examples: Ceramic insulators support power lines on electricity pylons safely
The electrician wrapped rubber insulator around the exposed wire
Fiberglass insulator in the attic keeps the house warm
They installed foam insulator between the walls for efficiency
Recording studios use acoustic insulator to prevent sound leakage
The insulator panels reduced noise from the neighboring apartment

definitions: hormone produced by pancreas that regulates glucose metabolism in the body
pharmaceutical preparation of insulin used to treat diabetes mellitus
examples: The pancreas releases insulin after meals to control blood sugar
Type 1 diabetics cannot produce insulin naturally in their bodies
She injects insulin three times daily to manage her diabetes
The doctor adjusted his insulin dosage based on glucose readings

definitions: rude or disrespectful comment intended to hurt or offend someone
physical or chemical injury to body tissue or organ systems
examples: His insult about her appearance left her feeling deeply hurt
Trading insults during the debate damaged both candidates' reputations
The stroke was an insult to the brain's language center
Repeated insults to the liver can cause permanent damage

definitions: contract providing financial protection against specified losses or damages
any measure taken to guard against undesirable outcomes or risks
examples: Their homeowner's insurance covered the hurricane damage completely
She purchased travel insurance before the international trip
Backing up files serves as insurance against computer crashes
The extra generator provides insurance against power outages

definitions: person covered by an insurance policy who receives benefits
property or assets protected under an insurance contract
examples: The insured must file claims within thirty days of loss
As the primary insured, she named her children as beneficiaries
The insured vehicle was totaled in the accident yesterday
All insured items must be documented with photographs and receipts

definitions: company that provides insurance coverage and assumes financial risk
person or organization that guarantees against specified losses
examples: The insurer denied the claim citing pre-existing conditions
Major insurers compete for customers with lower premium rates
The bank acted as insurer for the construction loan
Government serves as insurer of last resort during disasters

definitions: organized armed resistance against established government or authority
political movement using unconventional tactics to challenge existing power structures
examples: The military struggled to contain the growing insurgency
Foreign support fueled the insurgency for several years
Student insurgency against university policies gained widespread support
The political insurgency challenged traditional party dominance

definitions: person who actively participates in armed rebellion against authority
member of political movement challenging established systems or leaders
examples: Insurgents attacked the military convoy at dawn yesterday
The captured insurgent revealed locations of weapon caches
Party insurgents challenged the incumbent leadership during primaries
Young insurgents brought fresh ideas to the organization

definitions: violent uprising against civil authority or established government
organized attempt to overthrow political power through force
examples: The insurrection began with attacks on government buildings
Military forces quickly suppressed the attempted insurrection
Historical insurrections often sparked broader revolutionary movements
The failed insurrection resulted in mass arrests and trials

definitions: quantity of food, liquid, or air taken into the body
opening through which fluid or air enters a system
group of people admitted to institution at the same time
examples: Daily calorie intake should match your activity level
The doctor monitored her fluid intake after surgery
The engine's air intake filter needs regular cleaning
Water enters through the intake valve at high pressure
This year's student intake exceeded enrollment projections significantly
The military's newest intake began basic training yesterday

definitions: business asset without physical form such as patents or goodwill
quality or characteristic that cannot be touched or precisely measured
examples: The company's intangibles include trademarks and brand reputation
Accounting standards require special treatment for intangible assets
Team chemistry is an intangible that affects performance significantly
Cultural heritage represents intangibles passed through generations

definitions: mathematical whole number that can be positive, negative, or zero
examples: The integer -5 is less than the integer 3
Computer programs often use integer variables for counting
Converting decimals to integers requires rounding or truncation
The solution must be an integer between 1 and 100

definitions: mathematical operation finding area under curves or accumulation of quantities
fundamental part that is necessary for completeness of the whole
examples: The integral of velocity over time gives total distance
Students learned to evaluate definite integrals using calculus
Safety features are integral to modern vehicle design
These proteins form integral parts of cell membranes

definitions: act of combining separate elements into unified whole system
process of finding integrals in mathematical calculations
examples: Integrating new employees requires structured onboarding programs
The challenge lies in integrating legacy systems with modern technology
Integrating complex functions requires advanced mathematical techniques
The software handles integrating differential equations automatically

definitions: process of combining parts into unified functioning whole
mathematical method of finding integrals or areas under curves
inclusion of different groups into equal participation in society
examples: System integration required months of careful planning and testing
The integration of departments improved operational efficiency
Integration by parts simplifies certain calculus problems effectively
Numerical integration approximates areas when analytical solutions fail
School integration ended decades of educational segregation
Cultural integration helps immigrants adapt to new communities

definitions: electronic circuit that performs mathematical integration of signals
company or specialist that combines different systems into unified solutions
examples: The analog integrator accumulates voltage over time periods
Operational amplifiers serve as integrators in control circuits
The systems integrator connected all enterprise software platforms
Major integrators handle complex military procurement contracts

definitions: quality of having strong moral principles and consistent ethical behavior
state of being whole, complete, and structurally sound
accuracy and consistency of data throughout its lifecycle
examples: Her integrity prevented her from accepting the bribe
Leaders with integrity inspire trust in their organizations
Engineers tested the structural integrity after the earthquake
Corrosion compromised the pipeline's integrity over time
Database integrity ensures information remains accurate and consistent
File integrity checks detect unauthorized modifications

definitions: faculty of reasoning, understanding, and thinking abstractly
person of exceptional intelligence or mental ability
examples: His powerful intellect solved problems others found impossible
Education develops intellect through challenging mental exercises
The conference attracted leading intellects from various fields
She was considered an intellect of her generation

definitions: person engaged in critical thinking, research, and scholarly pursuits
relating to the intellect or its use in thinking
examples: Public intellectuals debated social issues in the media
The cafe attracted intellectuals from the nearby university
Intellectual property laws protect creative works and inventions
Chess requires significant intellectual effort and concentration

definitions: capacity for learning, reasoning, understanding, and similar cognitive activities
collection and analysis of information about enemies or competitors
secret information gathered by espionage or surveillance activities
examples: Artificial intelligence mimics human intelligence in specific tasks
Intelligence tests measure various cognitive abilities and skills
Military intelligence prevented the surprise attack
Business intelligence helps companies make strategic decisions
The spy transmitted intelligence about troop movements
Foreign intelligence agencies monitor potential security threats

definitions: educated elite class engaged in cultural, academic, and artistic leadership
examples: The intelligentsia shaped public opinion through their writings
Revolutionary movements often emerged from the urban intelligentsia
The cafe became a gathering place for the local intelligentsia
Government policies alienated much of the scientific intelligentsia

definitions: quality of being clear enough to be understood or comprehended easily
examples: Background noise reduced the speaker's intelligibility significantly
The document's intelligibility improved after professional editing
Speech therapy enhanced the child's intelligibility to listeners
Technical jargon decreased the manual's intelligibility for users

definitions: process of making something stronger, more extreme, or more concentrated
agricultural practice of increasing productivity through enhanced inputs and methods
examples: The intensification of storms concerns climate scientists worldwide
Diplomatic intensification of sanctions increased economic pressure
Agricultural intensification doubled crop yields per hectare
Land intensification reduces pressure to clear new farmland

definitions: degree of strength, force, or energy of something
extreme degree of emotional strength or passion
measurable amount of energy, brightness, or radiation per unit
examples: The storm's intensity reached category five hurricane levels
Workout intensity determines calories burned during exercise
The intensity of their argument shocked everyone present
She spoke with an intensity that commanded attention
Light intensity decreases with distance from the source
Earthquake intensity measured 6.5 on the Richter scale

definitions: course or program involving concentrated effort over short time
hospital unit providing specialized care for critically ill patients
examples: The language intensive covered six months of material
Summer intensives prepare dancers for professional auditions
The cardiac intensive monitors patients after heart surgery
Neonatal intensive care saves premature babies' lives daily

definitions: aim or purpose behind an action or decision
state of mind with which an act is done
examples: The law examines intent when determining criminal charges
Her intent was clearly to help, not harm
Criminal intent must be proven beyond reasonable doubt
The contract specifies the parties' intent in clear terms

definitions: thing intended as an aim or plan for future action
mental determination to act in a certain way
examples: His intention to retire surprised his colleagues
Good intentions don't always lead to good outcomes
She announced her intention to run for office
The letter clearly states their intention to appeal

definitions: quality of mental states being directed toward objects or goals
philosophical principle that consciousness is always about something
examples: The artwork's intentionality reflects the artist's social commentary
Teaching requires intentionality in lesson planning and delivery
Philosophers debate intentionality as fundamental to consciousness
Intentionality distinguishes mental phenomena from physical objects

definitions: reciprocal action or influence between people or things
communication or direct involvement between individuals
way different systems or components affect each other
examples: Drug interactions can cause dangerous side effects
The interaction between genes determines inherited traits
Social interaction skills develop through childhood experiences
Online interaction replaced face-to-face meetings during lockdown
User interaction with software should feel intuitive
Chemical interactions produce new molecular compounds

definitions: act of stopping something before it reaches intended destination
point where a line crosses an axis in coordinate geometry
communication or object seized while in transit
examples: The defensive intercept prevented a certain touchdown
Border agents made a drug intercept worth millions
The y-intercept shows where the line crosses the vertical axis
Calculate the x-intercept by setting y equal to zero
Intelligence services decoded the intercepted enemy transmissions
The intercept revealed plans for the surprise attack

definitions: act of preventing something from continuing to its destination
capture and decoding of electronic communications or signals
examples: The quarterback threw three interceptions in the game
Missile interception systems protect against aerial threats
Email interception by hackers compromised sensitive data
Legal interception requires proper court authorization

definitions: military aircraft designed to intercept and destroy enemy aircraft
device or system that blocks or captures something in transit
examples: Fighter interceptors scrambled to identify the unknown aircraft
The interceptor reached supersonic speeds during pursuit
The water interceptor prevents pollutants entering the river
Network interceptors monitor data packets for security threats

definitions: action of intervening on behalf of another to resolve conflict
act of praying to deity on behalf of another person
examples: The diplomat's intercession prevented the trade war
Parental intercession resolved the siblings' property dispute
The priest offered intercession for the congregation's needs
Saints provide intercession between believers and God

definitions: road junction where traffic switches between highways without crossing
mutual exchange of things between people or groups
act of putting things in each other's place
examples: The interstate interchange connects three major highways
Traffic backs up at the interchange during rush hour
Cultural interchange enriches both participating societies
The interchange of ideas sparked innovation
The interchange of players changed the game's momentum
Parts interchange between different model years

definitions: electronic device allowing voice communication between different rooms or areas
examples: The principal announced the fire drill over the intercom
She buzzed visitors in through the apartment intercom
The pilot spoke to passengers through the aircraft intercom
Office intercoms connect all departments for quick communication

definitions: state of being connected with each other in complex relationships
physical or logical connection between computer systems or networks
examples: The interconnection of global markets affects local economies
Ecosystem interconnections maintain natural balance
Network interconnection allows data sharing between companies
The interconnection agreement specifies bandwidth and pricing

definitions: sexual activity between individuals involving genital contact
communication or dealings between individuals or groups
examples: The study examined frequency of sexual intercourse among couples
Consensual intercourse requires clear communication between partners
Diplomatic intercourse between nations prevents conflicts
Commercial intercourse expanded with improved transportation

definitions: state where entities depend on each other for resources, support, or survival
examples: Economic interdependence makes nations less likely to wage war
The interdependence of organs keeps the body functioning
Ecosystem interdependence means harming one species affects others
Global interdependence increased with international trade expansion

definitions: authoritative prohibition or ban especially from religious authority
military action to prevent enemy movement or supply
examples: The papal interdict banned religious services in the kingdom
The court issued an interdict against the publication
Naval forces interdict drug smuggling routes at sea
Air interdicts disrupted enemy supply lines effectively

definitions: act of prohibiting or forbidding something authoritatively
military operations to prevent enemy forces or supplies from moving
examples: Drug interdiction efforts seized tons of illegal substances
The interdiction of weapons shipments prevented escalation
Battlefield interdiction targeted bridges and rail lines
Maritime interdiction operations patrol international waters

definitions: feeling of wanting to know or learn about something
money paid for the use of borrowed money
legal right or share in something
advantage or benefit of a person or group
examples: Her interest in astronomy began during childhood
The lecture sparked interest among the students
The loan carries an interest rate of five percent
Compound interest grows investments over time
She sold her interest in the company last year
Mining interests lobbied against environmental regulations
Acting in the public interest guides policy decisions
The lawyer must avoid conflicts of interest

definitions: point where two systems or subjects meet and interact
visual part of computer program that users interact with
surface forming common boundary between two portions of matter
examples: The software interface allows different programs to communicate
The neural interface connects the brain to computers
The graphical interface makes the program user-friendly
Touchscreen interfaces replaced physical keyboards on phones
Oil floats at the water interface due to density
The interface between materials affects heat transfer

definitions: action of interfering or state of being interfered with
disruption of broadcast signals by unwanted signals
interaction of waves that results in reinforcement or cancellation
examples: Government interference in markets can distort prices
Parental interference strained the couple's relationship
Radio interference made the broadcast hard to hear
Electronic interference affected the sensitive equipment
Light interference creates colorful patterns in soap bubbles
Wave interference produces standing wave patterns

definitions: time between two events or temporary intervening period
temporary or provisional arrangement pending permanent solution
examples: She served as CEO during the interim between appointments
The interim period lasted six months
The board appointed an interim president yesterday
Interim measures maintained operations during restructuring

definitions: inner part or inside of something especially a building
inland or central part of country or region
inner character or mental life of a person
examples: The interior designer transformed the living room completely
The car's leather interior impressed potential buyers
Explorers mapped the continent's interior over several expeditions
The interior receives less rainfall than coastal areas
His calm exterior masked a turbulent interior life
The novel explores the character's psychological interior

definitions: device preventing machine operation unless conditions are safe
method of joining things by fitting together
examples: The safety interlock stops the machine when doors open
Electrical interlocks prevent dangerous circuit combinations
The puzzle pieces interlock to form the picture
Interlocking stones create strong retaining walls

definitions: system of things fitting together in connected relationship
pattern or method where parts fit tightly together
examples: Interlocking directorates link major corporations together
The interlocking gears transfer power through the mechanism
The interlocking stones need no mortar for stability
Their interlocking fingers symbolized their commitment

definitions: person who takes part in dialogue or conversation
person who acts as intermediary in formal discussions
examples: His interlocutor challenged every point in the debate
The professor served as interlocutor for the discussion
The government appointed an interlocutor for treaty negotiations
Tribal interlocutors facilitated communication with authorities

definitions: intervening period of time between events or activities
short piece of music or entertainment between main sections
examples: The peaceful interlude ended when fighting resumed
Spring break provided a pleasant interlude from studies
The musical interlude allowed actors to change costumes
A comic interlude lightened the play's serious mood

definitions: marriage between people of different races, religions, or social groups
examples: Intermarriage between communities strengthened political alliances historically
Religious intermarriage raises questions about children's upbringing
The rate of intermarriage increased with social integration
Royal intermarriage connected European dynasties for centuries
